javaly.core

Class Test

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaly.core.Test

  • public final class Test
extends java.lang.Object
    Test is an adapter that wraps JUnit and provides a familiar interface for instructors who have previously used JUnit before which functions similarly to the Assert class of JUnit.

    All Test classes for Javaly that you write should import static all methods from this class. All test cases must be defined within methods and be annotated with the @TestCase tag. Note that the test case method can be of any name should not take in any arguments.

    You may check the results of your test cases with TestEngine.sampleRun().

    Usage is as below:

    Let's say your question expects a student to define the following function

    public static int add(int a, int b){return a + b;}

    You would have the following Test class: 

     import static javaly.core.Test.*;
 import javaly.core.*;
 public class AddTest{
  @TestCase(expectedOutput = "5")
  public void test0() {
   assertEquals(5, MethodHolder.add(2, 3));
  }

  @TestCase(expectedOutput = "6")
  public void test1() {
   assertEquals(6, MethodHolder.add(3, 3));
  }

  @TestCase(expectedOutput = "-1")
  public void test2() {
    assertEquals(-1, MethodHolder.add(-4, 3));
  }

 }

    Or more generally: 

     import static javaly.core.Test.*;
 import javaly.core.*;
 //other import statements
 ...

 public class GenericTest{
  @TestCase (expectedOutput = "Expected string to display in case of error")
  public void testX(){
    //preparation code
    ...
    //test code
    assertEquals([description,] expectedObject, outputObject);
    ...
  }
  //for system.out questions
  @TestCase (expectedOutput = "Expected string to display in case of error")
  public void testSysOut(){
    //preparation code
    ...
    //test code
    methodThatPrintsToSysOut();
    assertEquals([description,] expectedObject, retrieveSystemOutput());
    ...
  }
 }

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void addExceptionalCase(java.lang.String expected, java.lang.Throwable e)
      Adds a failed test case (due to a thrown exception) to the test results

      static void assertEquals(java.lang.String description, java.lang.Object o1, java.lang.Object o2)

    • Method Detail

      • assertEquals

        public static void assertEquals(java.lang.Object o1,
                                java.lang.Object o2)
        Compares two objects and saves the result to the collated results.

        The objects to be compared must already have the equals() method defined.

        Parameters:
        o1 - Expected object to be created
        o2 - Actual object created

      • assertEquals

        public static void assertEquals(java.lang.String description,
                                java.lang.Object o1,
                                java.lang.Object o2)
        Compares two objects and saves the result together with the description to the results storage.

        The objects to be compared must already have the equals() method defined.

        Parameters:
        description - Description of the test case
        o1 - Expected object to be created
        o2 - Actual object created

      • retrieveSystemOutput

        public static java.lang.String retrieveSystemOutput()
        Retrieves system output as a String from the redirected stream.

        Returns:
        A String with the contents of the redirected stdout stream.

      • getResults

        public static javaly.model.Results getResults()
        Retrieves the results assert statements.

        For internal use only.

        Returns:
        A Results object containing the results of the assert statements

      • addExceptionalCase

        public static void addExceptionalCase(java.lang.String expected,
                                      java.lang.Throwable e)
        Adds a failed test case (due to a thrown exception) to the test results

        For internal use only.

        Parameters:
        expected - The expected output as a String, to be set at the annotation
        e - The exception thrown

      • redirectSysOut

        public static void redirectSysOut()
        Redirects system out a temporary stream that can be retrieved.

        For internal use only.

      • rollbackSysOut

        public static void rollbackSysOut()
        Returns the sys out to stdout.

        For internal use only.
